As Arizona's premier trade association for science and technology companies, the Arizona Technology Council is the driving force behind making our state the fastest growing technology hub in the nation; connecting and empowering Arizona’s technology community. The Arizona Technology Council offers numerous events, educational forums and business conferences that bring together leaders, managers, employees and visionaries to make an impact on the technology industry. Council members work toward furthering the advancement of technology in Arizona through leadership, education, legislation and social action. These interactions contribute to the Council's culture of growing member businesses and transforming technology in Arizona.
Arizona Technology Council | AZ Tech Council
Arizona Technology Council | AZ Tech Council

The mission of the Tempe Chamber of Commerce is to build an environment that enhances the economic vitality of our membership.  We are one of the largest Chambers of Commerce in Arizona with over 1000 members, and are accredited by the US Chamber of Commerce.  I am responsible for growing the Chamber's membership and working with the existing members on achieving member value.  Their success is my business.
Council of Educational Facility Planners International (CEFPI)

The Council is a professional association whose sole mission is improving the places where children learn. CEFPI members — individuals, institutions and corporations — are actively involved in planning, designing, building, equipping and maintaining schools and colleges.  In this capacity I served as the primary contact for & coordinator of the Council's global membership acquisition & retention efforts (3,300 members).  I served on the Membership Committee along with the Council’s Global Membership Chairs. I was also responsible for coordinating membership marketing material, branding, & promotion.

Office of the Governor that directly advised the Arizona Governor on Mexico/Latin American Affairs.  The Arizona-Mexico Commission (AMC) is Arizona’s premiere cross-border nonprofit organization. The mission is to improve the well-being and quality of life for residents of Arizona by promoting a strong, cooperative relationship with Mexico and Latin America through advocacy, trade, networking and information.  I was honored to serve at the pleasure of the Governors Hull & Napolitano as one of the 6 staff members that made up this team.

summary: Brian is a highly self-motivated, hard working, extremely educated, fast learning, and professional individual who enjoys a challenge and exploring all parts of life and the world. Through his experiences he has learned to successfully adapt to any foreign environment and situation on a both professional and social level with the ability to succeed with any tasks assigned. He is someone who is a strong advocate of education and constantly seeks to grow in both academic and street smarts, as well as professionally through empowerment and mentorship.  Brian is a strong believer in the saying: "There is no future in saying it can't be done."Specialties: Brian's specialties include local, state, regional, and international development, as well as Bi-national border affairs.
